title: 103_hr2143
content:
The Act titled "Nuclear Regulatory Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995" authorizes appropriations for those fiscal years. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized to receive appropriations for fiscal years 1994 and 1995, with specific amounts allocated for each year. The funds are to remain available until expended, with a portion authorized from the Nuclear Waste Fund. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized to receive appropriations for fiscal years 1994 and 1995, with specific amounts allocated for each year. $22,000,000 is authorized from the Nuclear Waste Fund. The Office of Inspector General is allocated $4,800,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $5,000,000 for fiscal year 1995, with funds remaining available until expended. SEC. 3. ALLOCATION OF AMOUNTS AUTHORIZED. The amounts authorized under section 2(a) for fiscal years 1994 and 1995 are allocated as follows: 
- $163,807,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $168,005,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Reactor Safety and Safeguards Regulation"
- $99,969,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $98,339,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Reactor Safety Research"
- $61,880,000 for "Nuclear Material and Low-Level Waste Safety and Safeguards Regulation" For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, funding allocations include $61,880,000 for "Nuclear Material and Low-Level Waste Safety and Safeguards Regulation" and $22,000,000 for "High-Level Nuclear Waste Regulation." The Nuclear Regulatory Commission allocated funds for various purposes including reactor special reviews, nuclear safety management, and enforcement for fiscal years 1994 and 1995. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission allocated $164,062,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Nuclear Safety Management and Support." The Commission is limited to using no more than 1 percent of the allocated funds for grants and cooperative agreements with organizations. Grants must comply with relevant laws. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate allocated funds for different programs or activities within the same fiscal year, as long as it complies with relevant laws and limitations. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds within a fiscal year for specific programs, with a limit of $500,000 increase or decrease without prior notification to relevant committees. The notification must include details of the reallocation and reasons for it. The Nuclear Waste Fund can only be used for high-level nuclear waste activities of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission and cannot be reallocated for other Commission activities. SEC. 4. RETENTION OF CERTAIN FUNDS.

Money received by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for cooperative nuclear safety research, services to foreign governments, and material access programs may be retained for associated expenses, subject to appropriations, and remain available until expended.

SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS. SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can transfer funds to its Office of Inspector General, not exceeding 5 percent of the authorized amount for the fiscal year. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON SPENDING AUTHORITY. Payments under this Act are subject to advance approval in appropriation Acts.
